title: Gisele Bündchen is seen visiting her spiritual healer again
author: Andrea Cavallier
description: Gisele Bündchen was spotted visiting her spiritual healer in Miami for the second time this month amid her split from NFL star husband Tom Brady.
cleaned_text: Super powers for the supermodel! Gisele Bündchen is spotted making second visit to her spiritual healer in less than two weeks - as she leaves with an Amazon box amid split from NFL legend Tom Brady - Supermodel Gisele Bündchen, 42, was spotted meeting with a spiritual healer on Wednesday - It's the second time this month she's been seen at the healer amid split from husband Tom Brady - Bündchen, who reportedly hired a divorce lawyer, has not been seen at any of Tom's games this season - It's unclear what treatment Bündchen sought but Dr. Ewa offers multiple techniques, including Chromotherapy, Sound Therapy, Light Therapy and cupping, according to her website - The supermodel was spotted at the same healer earlier this month where the healer burned a Palo Santo incense stick, known to remove negative energy, while she sat inside her car - Bündchen was also spotted outside a Miami gym without her luxurious diamond wedding ring - Divorce rumors between Bündchen and Brady have been escalating since the NFL star decided to return to the field this year after announcing his retirement Gisele Bündchen was spotted visiting her spiritual healer in Miami for the second time this month amid her split from NFL star husband [Tom Brady](/tvshowbiz/tom-brady/index.html). Bündchen, 42, appeared downcast as she walked outside after visiting with Dr. Ewa, a spiritual healer who empowers 'patients to understand their bodies and discover the gentle power of the healing arts.' The supermodel wore a sheer white t-shirt, loose green joggers, a prayer necklace and carried an Amazon box as she left the healer last Wednesday. It's unclear what treatment Bündchen sought but Dr. Ewa offers multiple techniques, including Chromotherapy, Sound Therapy, Light Therapy and cupping, according to her website. It's the second time since the start of the month that Bündchen has visited the healer. The visit comes just a few days before Tom Brady hit the field again on Sunday winning against the Atlanta Falcons. Bündchen, who reportedly hired a divorce lawyer, has not been seen at any of his games this season. Gisele Bündchen was spotted visiting her spiritual healer for the second time amid her split from NFL star husband Tom Brady Bündchen, 42, appeared downcast as she walked outside after visiting with Dr. Ewa, a spiritual healer who empowers 'patients to understand their bodies and discover the gentle power of the healing arts' It's unclear what treatment Bündchen sought but Dr. Ewa offers multiple techniques, including Chromotherapy, Sound Therapy, Light Therapy and cupping, according to her website Just last week, Bündchen was seen sitting in her car as Dr. Ewa burned a Palo Santo incense stick used to 'remove negative energy.' Dr. Ewa appeared to be 'blessing' the exterior and interior of the supermodel's white SUV before warmly embracing Bündchen and taking her inside. A practitioner of Ayurvedic Medicine, Dr. Ewa also uses alternative methods, such as Thai Medical, Cranio-Sacral Therapy, Myofascial Therapy, Oriental Medicine Therapy as cupping, guasha, Body Logic, Chromotherapy, Biological Light Therapy, Sound Therapy, Light Therapy, for ongoing treatment according to her site. The supermodel is known to take a holistic approach to her health and it appears she may need more intervention amid reports of her split from Brady. The supermodel and Brady, 45, have reportedly hired divorce lawyers 13 years after saying 'I do' in 2009, according to multiple reports. The supermodel took the lead on hiring an attorney and the NFL star followed her lead while 'figuring out what to do,' according to People. The supermodel wore a t-shirt, loose green joggers, a prayer necklace and carried an Amazon box as she left the healer Bündchen, who was spotted visiting the healer for a second time this month, takes a call while outside the healer's office. She is known to take a holistic approach to her health Bündchen ducked into her car as she talked on the phone and left the healer's office RINGLESS: The supermodel's hand was bare of a ring as she carried an amazon box outside the healer's office Wednesday 'I don't think there will be any coming back now,' an anonymous source told Page Six. 'They both have lawyers and are looking at what a split will entail, who gets what and what the finances will be.' Bündchen was also recently spotted in the parking lot of her gym, along with her children Benjamin, 12, and Vivian, 9, on Tuesday with her luxurious diamond ring missing from her left hand as she locked the car door. She styled a white sporty tank and gray bottoms while her golden locks sat below her shoulders. Bündchen's two children appeared to carry towels as they locked up their car and headed inside. The Victoria's Secret model is rumored to be staying separately from the NFL quarterback as he returned to Tampa to practice for the Buccaneers' game. The duo have been working through a rough patch as Brady's re-entering the NFL allegedly triggered a rift in their relationship. Brady and Bündchen are rumored to be assessing how they would divide their assets, including their $26 million property portfolio. The pair recently purchased a $17 million home on Indian Creek Island in Miami, dubbed 'Billionaires Bunker.' The two would have joined A-list celebrities in residing on the exclusive waterfront island, including Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Aside from the Miami property, the pair also have a condo in New York City worth $3.6 million and another $5.7 million property at an exclusive Yellowstone club in Montana. While there were multiple destinations the couple could've ran to amid Hurricane Ian in Florida last week, Bündchen reportedly stayed with the couple's children in Miami while Brady stayed somewhere else. Aside from the couple's two kids Vivian and Benjamin, the former Patriots star has a 15-year-old son, Jack, from his previous relationship with Bridget Moynahan. Another messy battle for the lawyers to decide is custody of their shared children. Going solo: It's not clear where Tom has been staying, though he is not at home, where his three children are also staying; seen with (L-R) Benjamin, 12; Jack, 15; and Vivian, nine Bündchen previously said that she put her career on the sidelines to support her husband Brady's net worth after beginning his football career on the New England Patriots in 2001 has skyrocketed to $250 million. Meanwhile, Bündchen's net worth is similar after spending years as a Victoria Secret model. The supermodel previously admitted during an interview with Elle Magazine on September 13 that she had to put her career on the sidelines. Bündchen was looking forward to jump starting her career again after Brady's retirement - and appears to be going forward with her goals despite Brady's decision to return to the field. 'I've done my part, which is [to] be there for [Tom],' she told Elle Magazine. 'I moved to Boston, and I focused on creating a cocoon and a loving environment for my children to grow up in and to be there supporting him and his dreams. 'Seeing my children succeed and become the beautiful little humans that they are, seeing him succeed, and being fulfilled in his career — it makes me happy. At this point in my life, I feel like I've done a good job on that. 'I have a huge list of things that I have to do, that I want to do. At 42, I feel more connected with my purpose,' Bündchen said. Brady was pictured at his recent October 2 game alongside Buccaneer teammates. His supermodel wife is known to cheer him on during the games but hasn't been present this season Bündchen previously admitted her worries about Brady walking back on his retirement plans. 'This is a very violent sport, and I have my children and I would like him to be more present,' Bündchen told Elle Magazine. 'I have definitely had those conversations with him over and over again. But ultimately, I feel that everybody has to make a decision that works for [them]. He needs to follow his joy too.' On his regularly scheduled 'Let's Go!' podcast last month, the seven-time Super Bowl champion did not mention his marital challenges directly, but spoke about the importance of family. Brady mentioned that he has spent Thanksgiving and Christmas away from his family since joining the NFL. 'I haven't had a Christmas in 23 years, and I haven't had a Thanksgiving in 23 years, I haven't celebrated birthdays with people that I care about that are born from August to late January. And I'm not able to be at funerals and I'm not able to be at weddings,' Brady told his co-host, Jim Gray. Brady and Bündchen are supposedly 'living separately' amid marital issue rumors after the football star decided to return to the field after announcing his retirement in February Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen's eco-mansion is beginning to take shape on the $17 million plot of land which has a waterfront view of Biscayne Bay, near Miami, Florida While rumors swirl that Brady and Bündchen's rift was spurred by the NFL star's return to the field, Dailymail.com can confirm the couple's rumored split is unrelated to Brady's surprise return. He had initially quit his career, in part, to focus on his family - as he vowed to spend more time with them since Gisele 'deserves what she needs from me as a husband, and my kids deserve what they need from me as a dad.' Bündchen is her husband's 'number one cheerleader' and said she would not care if he played until he was in his 50s. But the friction between the two has still resulted in them living apart from one another. The comments below have not been moderated.
